TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE ( GPE ) . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The respondent Government were represented by their successive Agents , respectively Mr U. ORG and Mr PERSON , and by their successive co - Agents , respectively Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant is the owner of a flat in GPE , which he had let to GPE , ORG and PERSON

In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , the applicant informed the tenants of his intention to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on CARDINAL DATE and summoned them to appear before the GPE Magistrate .
By a decision of DATE , which was made enforceable on CARDINAL DATE , ORG upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenants requiring them to vacate the premises .
On DATE , he informed the tenants that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .

DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
On DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that he urgently required the premises as accommodation for himself .
Pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , all the enforcement proceedings were suspended until DATE .
Pursuant to LAW no CARDINAL of DATE , all the enforcement proceedings were suspended until DATE .

According to the last information provided by the applicant on DATE , he has not yet recovered possession of the flat due to PERSON n. CARDINAL of DATE which suspended all the enforcement proceedings until DATE .
